lines.text: Besides, you don't want to be an orphan forever.
So adopt me, why don't you!
They won't let me adopt you on my salary; besides, you deserve a mother *and* a father.
So, get a husband.
It's not like buying a car, you know.
I know. It's got to be that can't-eat, can't-sleep, reach-for-the-stars, over-the-fence, World Series kind of stuff, right?
Hey, a girl's got to have her standards.
You know, I really thought it was that can't-eat, can't-sleep, reach-for-the-stars, over- the-fence, World Series kind of stuff.
All this money and these people eat slugs?
I have never been more humiliated in my life!
[turns to walk off and huffs]
Wanna bet?
[she steps on Clarice's wedding dress so that everyone can see her underpants]
Aren't you coming?
Uh, no, I think I'm just gonna wait for Amanda out here.
DIANE BARROWS! GET YOUR BUTT UP HERE THIS... IN-STANT!
Okay. Okay. Maybe I'll just stand in the back and take a little look-see.
I can't believe you talked me into this!
You're too tense. Relax.
Oh, I've got a thousand pounds of wild animal under my butt and she says relax!
You should really put iodine on your butt... cut.
Sorry to ruin your wedding. I just didn't want the wrong girl going down the aisle. I mean the wrong flower girl.
I think you had it right the first time.

[Amanda, as Alyssa, bangs a tune on the piano]
Do you think maybe my daughter's asking for a little attention?
I'd say she's demanding it.

[as Amanda bangs the final notes]
Hmm.
Whoa! Check it out! Buckingham Palace!

[in a know-it-all tone]
That's in London, brainless. It's the Calloway House.
Nobody's lived there for years. It's haunted.
It's not, either!
Ask anyone. Every full moon, Old Lady Calloway's ghost crosses the lake and eats one of the campers.
Yeah, right, and Santa Claus lives with the tooth fairy in Queens.
Cookie, Muffin, Candy... They don't marry girls like me.
How was the party?
Well, the good news is, Clarice is gone.
You did it!
The bad news is, she'll be back in a week.
Oh, you didn't.
My god - you're *not* Alyssa!
Nope. Name's Amanda, put 'er there!
[shakes Vincenzo's hand]
Identical strangers? Holy mackerel, that's amazing!
Yeah, and it's weird, too!
This - is all YOUR fault!
[she raises her arm to hit Amanda, who poses as Alyssa, but Vincenzo furiously grabs her arm and stops her; Clarice turns to him]
Lady, if you touch that child, I'll pop you one, so help me God!

[surprised that Amanda and Alyssa are identical]
This is amazing.

Yeah. And it's weird, too. Now, I understand that through some, uh, some simple mix-up, that Alyssa is in a care of child's services. Now, I've been authorized to tell you, that if I get her back right away, there'll be no legal entanglements.
Um, you see, she's not exactly with me, here.
What?
She's been... Well, she was adopted.
Well, then you'd better unadopt her, quick! Mr. Callaway's gettin' married in 90 minutes at St. Bartholomew's! He's expecting his daughter to be there, his *real* daughter.
*90 minutes*?
Yeah.
Well, I can't even get to Staten Island and back in 90 minutes!
Well, may I suggest that you go really, *really* fast?
[he writes down a number]
Here. If you get into any trouble, call this number.
[he hands it to Diane]
Ask for Lou!
[he leaves, and Diane looks at the number]
Lou. Lou Who?
[Diane and Alyssa see a horse-drawn carriage, and Alyssa gets on]
Oh, no. NOT another horse!
Diane, come *on*!
Fine.
[she gets into the carriage]
Where is the driver?
[she notices that the driver is at the hot dog stand, eating hot dogs]
Oh! Hey, buddy! Listen, you've gotta take us to St. Bart's right away; it's an emergency!

[through a mouthful of hot dog]
We're closed, miss. I'm on my break!

[Diane turns to Alyssa, and makes a gesture telling her to get in the driver's seat and take the reins, both of which Alyssa does, and Diane gets in the passenger seat and turns angrily to the driver]

[sarcastically]
I wanna thank you for all your help, bud!

[whips the reins]
HYAH!
[the horse runs off, pulling the carriage, but Diane falls backwards into the seat]

[notices and almost runs after his horse]
Hey. Hey, lady! Hey, that's...
[spits out his mouthful, then screams after them]
THAT'S MY HORSE!
Told ya. Third time's a charm...
Wait. All of this? This was *your* doing?
[Amanda and Alyssa smile]
Oh, it *was*, was it?
Well, girls, what do you have to say for yourselves?
So kiss already!
I made my money the old-fashioned way - pure dumb luck.
This orphan stuff is like growing up in the dog-pound. Everybody wants a puppy.
I don't know what's more bruised, my butt or my ego.
"Rough" is a broken nail, darling, what I'm having is a *train wreck*!

[bangs loudly on Butkises' door]
Hello! Hello!
You lookin' for a Butkis?
What?
You lookin' for a Butkis?
Yes! Yes, I am. Do you know where he is?
At the salvage yard. Where else? Harry works those poor kids to the bone.
What do you mean?
Why do you think he's got so many?

Lots of tie-ups this mornin'. It's 20 minutes for the Lincoln, 10 for the Holland. The B.Q.E. is backed up for about 2 miles, and if you're takin' the Van Wyck, better allow an extra 15. Whateva ya do, stay outta midtown. It's gonna be wall-to-wall limos as socialite Clarice Kensington finally lands her man!

[after Alyssa, as Amanda, was 'adopted' by the Butkises]
You were supposed to protect her! You should've done something. Y-Y-You could've slit their tires or something! Anything!
They had the paperwork!
*What* paperwork?

[hands Diane the paperwork]
We couldn't find you! Miss Van Dyke was here. What did you want us to do, lie in front of the van, for God's sake?
I would have!
[she drops the paperwork]
I'm takin' the Jeep!
[she takes the keys to the Jeep]
Hey, that's the camp's!

[furiously]
Oh, don't you even...!

[drives all the way to Staten Island]
I must be crazy. But I'm not goin' in that church. No matter what happens, I am NOT goin' in that church!

[to Vincenzo, after thinking that Clarice wants to sell the mansion]
I've lost my mother, now I've lost my father! I have no family. I'm an orphan, and I'm running away, so don't you dare tell Daddy!

[after Alyssa posing as Amanda gets off the phone with Amanda posing as Alyssa]
New kids aren't allowed to use the phone. Butkis rules.

[entering the bridal dressing room with a Prozac]
I knew somebody in this church would have a Prozac.

[snatching the Prozac, impatiently]
What is taking so long?
[gulps the Prozac down]

[soothingly]
Relax, Clary. Enjoy the moment. This is the happiest day of your life.

[quietly at first, then temperamentally]
I'm happy. Don't I look happy? This is me happy! See!
[chuckles, then chants]
Happy-happy-happy-happy-happy-happy-happy!
[bellows]
Let's get this show on the road!
Clarice! Your hair! I mean you're here!
If you embarrass me in front of me in front of all these people, I'll make sure you never play anything, ever, again. Have I made myself clear?

[as Alyssa]
Clear as glass.
[Drops her chewed escargot in Clarice's champagne glass]
In fact, I can see right through you.

[as she watches Amanda dash into the woods during a flag football game]
Great speed. Bad sense of direction.

[to the home office on the phone]
Let me just run this by you one more time, okay? Please, just hear me out, one more time. Okay. I know I don't make that much money, and I know that I'm a little bit single, but I want to adopt Amanda. No, I - Are you laughing at me?
[to Patty]
He's laughing at me!
[to phone]
You - YOU STUPID JERK!
[hangs up in fury]
You're not a reject. It's just that, most people want to adopt...
Babies. I know.
Vincenzo, did you ever hit a home run?
Not recently.

You know the feeling when it's the bottom of the ninth, the bases are loaded, and you know the next one's coming right down the middle. And then, you just connect... and for an instant, you know that it's going over the fence and out of the park... and further than you could ever imagine.
Yeah, that's a great feeling.
Yeah.
[pauses, closes wedding ring box]
Clarice hates baseball.
Where the hell is everybody? Vincenzo!

[to Amanda]
I sure hope you've got a plan.

[as Alyssa]
I'm just so terribly relieved that you're not... pissed.
Pissed, miss?

[as he as Clarice take their first few steps down the aisle]
Who would have thought my first little girl would be the last to get married?

[chuckles, then exasperated]
Aw, Daddy... shut up!
[short huff]
Enough of this.
